page.title: 19Henbury Farm / Coombe Almer
page.content:
Henbury farm is a large{Victorian {farmhouse,}entered through the farmyard. The farm has 240 acres, growing bulbs, potatoes and there is a herd of 100 dairy cows. The milk and potato quotas inhibit expansion. Some potatoes and flowers are sold at the farm door to{passing motorists}on the A31 road. The bulbs, after being lifted and sterilised are sold to growers in Holland. The farmer's wife expressed {depression and frustration over EEC {policies and interference.
Coombe Almer farm, in the valley between Sturminster Marshall and Lytchett Matravers, is mainly dairy and pasture farm. There has been a farm here for many centuries and the buildings were rebuilt in brick in the 19th century.
